intro: Pentaschistis montana, commonly known as the mountain pentaschistis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a white or pale yellow color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
